newsitem.title: YUGOSLAVIA: Yugoslav April wages rise 2.8 pct to 733 dinars.
newsitem.headline: Yugoslav April wages rise 2.8 pct to 733 dinars.

text.p: The Federal Statistics Office reported the following economic indicator details.
YUGOSLAV AVERAGE NET WAGES APRIL MARCH APRIL 96
NOTES -- Year-on-year April wages were 49.3 percent higher in nominal terms and 18.2 percent in real terms against the same month in 1996.
April wages were 4.4 percent up on December 1996 in nominal terms and 0.5 percent in real terms.
Cumulative April-January wages were 56.6 percent higher in nominal terms than in the same four-month period last year, and 26.6 percent up on the average for 1996.

The Federal Statistic Office revised its methodologyy of calculating average wages in January 1997 to include all employed who worked in a given month, regardless of whether they all received wages earned in that month.
Data do not include private sector. Data cover Federal Republic of Yugoslavia, comprising Serbia and Montenegro. -- Amra Kevic, Belgrade newsroom +381 11 222 4305
